title: Wood Type name?
content:
Anyone knows what are the names of the following wood types and if they have been digitised?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414040450im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Wood%20Types_5331.png)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Wood Types.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414040450/http:/typophile.com/files/Wood%20Types.png) | 973.3 KB |
author: jch02140

comments.content:
A great many woodtype faces didn't have names, but were identified by number.

Similar to MOUNTED, but must narrower... [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/spindletop-wbw/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414040450/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/spindletop-wbw/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/spindletop-wbw/")

Similar to READING/RADIANCE... [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/jefferson-pilot-wbw/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414040450/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/jefferson-pilot-wbw/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/jefferson-pilot-wbw/")

PUBLIC INDORSEMENT… [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/san-marcos-wbw/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414040450/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/san-marcos-wbw/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/san-marcos-wbw/")

At least some are William Page Chromatic [multicolor] fonts dating from around the 1860s and 1870s.  
As Nick says, these were usually identified by number. However, in later years some were given names, particularly when metal type versions were released.  
Some of these might match your mystery fonts [https://www.myfonts.com/person/William\_Hamilton\_Page/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414040450/https:/www.myfonts.com/person/William_Hamilton_Page/ "https://www.myfonts.com/person/William\_Hamilton\_Page/")  
Don
